content.details: PM Surya Ghar: Muft Bijli Yojana is a government scheme that aims to provide free electricity to households in India. The scheme was launched by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on February 15, 2024. Under the scheme, households will be provided with a subsidy to install solar panels on their roofs. The subsidy will cover up to 40% of the cost of the solar panels. The scheme is expected to benefit 1 crore households across India. It is estimated that the scheme will save the government Rs. 75,000 crore per year in electricity costs.
benefits: Reduced electricity costs for the government.
eligibility: The household must be an Indian citizen.
The household must own a house with a roof that is suitable for installing solar panels.
The household must have a valid electricity connection.
The household must not have availed any other subsidy for solar panels.

faqs.question: What is scheme all about?
faqs.answer: This is a government scheme that aims to provide free electricity to households in India.

faqs.question: What benefits are provided?
faqs.answer: 1. Subsidy on the Suitable Rooftop Solar Plant Capacity for households. 2. Free electricity for households. 3. Reduced electricity costs for the government. 4. Increased use of renewable energy. 5. Reduced carbon emissions.

faqs.question: Who can get the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: 1. The household must be an Indian citizen. 2. The household must own a house with a roof that is suitable for installing solar panels. 3. The household must have a valid electricity connection. 4. The household must not have availed any other subsidy for solar panels.

faqs.question: What is the procedure to get the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: 1. Applicant must register themselves. 2. Submit the online application form.

faqs.question: What documents are required?
faqs.answer: 1. Proof of identity. 2. Proof of address. 3. Electricity bill. 4. Roof ownership certificate.

faqs.question: What types of roofs are suitable for Rooftop solar (RTS) system?
faqs.answer: Rooftop solar PV systems can be installed on any type of roof having sufficient load bearing capacity.

faqs.question: Can applicant install Rooftop Solar system if applicant lives in a rented house?
faqs.answer: The RTS under any framework like net or gross metering can be installed by the electricity consumer. So, if applicant has electricity connection in his/her name and he/she pays regularly the electricity bill in his/her own name and also has the permission of use the roof for solar rooftop installation from the owner, he/she can install the RTS.

faqs.question: If applicant shifts his/her residence or office where RTS is installed, what will happen to the RTS?
faqs.answer: The system is easy to be dismantled and reassembled elsewhere. So, it can be shifted to new residence.
